rComments: This is a prof that actually cares! I also had him for 3323 and he always gave very clear instructions and if anything was not clear he would hold office hours online where you could ask questions often on the day the assignment was due. He seems monotone at first but you can tell he really cares about what he is teaching and has a passion for it.

This Professor isn't bad at teaching but is extremely vague about what he wants. Did the report and read each chapter and applied all the material but still managed to miss sections that he never mentioned. The course is reading heavy but the only difficult part is the report and exam.

I had heard so many bad things about him but the class was great! There is weekly quizzes that you don't have very much time to complete and the course is very heavy for reading material but his lectures were interesting and he was really nice! He was available outside of class and gave good feedback on project material. Exams were fair but hard

Guolla was by far one of the best profs i've had while studying marketing in Telfer. He is very knowledgeable and was so receptive to feedback about course structure for virtual classes. Stay engaged in his classes and you should be able to earn a great mark! This professor is iconic, witty and connects well with his students!

Guolla is such an underrated professor, constantly trying to find better ways to deliver the course, getting rid of exams, focusing on practical assignments. PPP was my third class with him. He's always available to answer questions and goes out of his way to put you in a group that matches your work ethic. If you put the work in, guaranteed A.

The course is interesting but the delivery is terrible: the hardest class I've taken. If you're a marketing student, you have no choice because he's the only one that teaches it so GL. Insanely hard final exam and weekly quizzes are 25 MC with 10 minutes to complete. Group case study was extremely vague and he doesn't help when you ask him.

Knows what he's talking about but his grading criteria is insane: MC quizzes weekly that are 25 questions and you have 12 minutes to complete. Group case project was vague and no clear grading criteria. Final exam was just 5 long answer questions; had to relate everything learned in class. Since its online, he made it even harder on the deliverable

I've had Guolla for many classes in the past, and he seems to have lost interest in his profession as time went on. He gave VERY unclear directions and expectations for this class and then got upset when we asked clarification questions and still didn't quite grasp what he wanted from us. Maybe he's not a fan of online classes, but this was brutal.
Not bad of a professor, he wrote the textbook so he know what he's talking about.

Guolla is a great prof for Market Research. He's funny and ironic, however, knows every singles student by name and goes out of his way to help you with projects; very knowledgeable. Exams are very fair and totally based on book material. Group project is really hands-on, useful, and interesting. Get a good group or RIP, as it's 50% of final mark.

Just save yourself the hassle and dont take him made what was suppose to be an easy class a nuisance extremely hard marker if he doesnt like you,he shows favourites hell make it seem like the final exams easy but get ready to write a novel for it, and group cases are hit or miss

I've had him for ADM3323 and ADM3326. For ADM3326, he's not bad and delivers the content of the course decently, but he's vague for the case studies. Definitely more of a nightmare in ADM3323, where his feedback isn't useful and everything is too vague. He seems to think he's all this and that too, but he isn't. You have no teacher choice sadly.

Going into his class you get the impression that he's a great and funny guy. but a few weeks in you'd realize he's very vague in what he wants from you and doesn't give you helpful feedback. His final is 120 multiple choice and 4 pages worth of long answers. which I think is a bit excessive for a class about making surveys.

Guolla was literally the best prof for marketing at Telfer. I had him for 3 classes and he cares so much about his students. he wants you to succeed and it took me to take Ads and Sale then Market Research and only once I took PPP with him I realized why he pushed us to greatness in the previous two courses. He is so fun and caring, a real gem

Great professor, humour and funny, focus on giving realistic case and examples to help to understand the stuff. Interesting lectures but not tough markers, have 2 midterms but not a heavy stuff. Reading and remembering are important, talking to him would be helpful for the group project. Great Prof!

He was a great professor in Ads & Sales (ADM3326). Then I got to Market Research and ended up hating the guy. Very unclear what he wants you to do in the course and on the final. The final is 1/2 MC 1/2 case but he makes you hand in the MC before you're allowed access to the case.

Guolla is a fantastic prof. Would highly recommend taking him. He engages students and tries to bring out the best in every student. Had him for Triple P and ads class. Midterms for ads are easy. Triple P is a tough class but enjoyable as it is practical.

Test material is very textbook heavy, and his lectures only expand on the textbook material to help you better understand. VERY dry sense of humor, sometimes doesn't come across as appropriate for a classroom because it can be rude and he calls people out on purpose. Overall,  easy marker for group work/case studies and sets you up for success.

One of the best profs and most useful classes I've had because you actually learn applicable  and relevant subject matter. The group cases are fun to do and you learn lots from it. Guolla's hilarious, sometimes he'll put you on the spot and I guess some people don't like that, but it gets the whole class engaged every lecture.
He's a knowledgeable professor and likes to push his students to do their best.

First day of class he tries to rationalize with you about why the textbook costs $150 (he wrote it).. However a lot of the information including key terms and definitions at the end of the chapters are now online. So once you're done this common sense class, the book is half as valuable. Easy class though. Review more opinions on Connect.

Really great and fair professor. Case studies allow you to apply what  you learned so you can really retain the information after the course is done. Knows you by name and will go out of his way to help you if he sees you really care. Overall excellent.

Decent prof, try's to make it exciting. Attendance is mandatory and he will force you to talk. These are both worth grades. Exams reflect course material well. Cases are pretty difficult, especially the 2nd one. He writes the textbook so it will be a must!

Great prof! He does the case study method, which is very interesting. By the end of the semester you feel like you have actually learned something! He really wants the students to do well, and have fun in the course!

Took Guolla for two separate classes in two separate semesters. His lectures are relatively discussion based and he likes to challenge his students by asking questions in class..**Stay off your phone!! He WILL know everyone's name, and will take grades away for phone use. This class is simple: read when you're told to, listen to the advice he gives
It isn't an easy course. The resources are all there for you, but you need to do the readings and attend lectures because he will notice if you skip. Too many group projects.
AMAZING PROFESSOR. Knew everyone by name by the end of the year. Such an interesting class, fair quizzes (straight from the book) and very fair final.
Class is very interesting, unique teaching style.  Lectures are more of discussions of the cases, not really a traditional lecture.  Always willing to help his students.  Overall a good professor.

Guolla is very helpful if he knows you are genuinely interested in learning and succeeding. He doesn't waste his time on people who don't want to learn. Great prof with alot of knowledge and great teaching tools. Ads & Sales is a lot of discussion learning. Market Research is a bit tougher but by the end you realize actually how much you learned.

This guy is the most sarcastic teacher youll ever have. His satire humour makes for an interesting class but he grades exetremely unfairly and is very unhelpful. He enjoys his power trips and loves making fun of students. Hes kind of a nice guy but there are way better options as marketing profs at Ottawa U.

Great professor! really challenges one to learn his taught material. If your looking for a challenge then he is the right professor. Makes you back up your answers. participate in class, and use his criticism constructively and your in for a great experience. one of the best professors, i've ever had!
Ready the chapters before the lectures. Cram the book in order to get an A

Seriously, this dude probably got bullied all his life and now when he got a chance to teach us, he's taking his frustration out. He will never give you a straight answer instead he will be like" well we read it in the book" go see this chapter. I mean com'on !!!! he needs an attitude change and he should let go of his frustration and teach!!

Read the material before going to class -- you'll know what's going on and will have intelligent things to contribute to the class discussion. He will like you and your mark will benefit. Interesting and enjoyable lectures; the whole room is involved. Pretty easy work if you pay attention and read the book! Midterms = DIRECTLY from the book.

Probably the best prof and best class I have taken in my 3 years at Uottawa. His critisms for favouritism is somewhat displaced. He likes discussion. So partake in class discussion and he will like you = simple. Plus, its fun to participate in his class because he challenges you and others on certain issues. Heavy workload, simple material.

Guolla is the worst professor i had in my entire university career , i really hated every minute of his class i really hope another professor teaches this course. EGO , FAVORITISM, RUDENESS  this is Guolla ,, if you don't have to take this class don't take it or try to take it online he is terrible and is in desperate need of an attitude change ..

Hard to take him seriously at times.. no real work experience to speak of which doesn't help the credibility of his opinions...  overall arrogant and kind of an ****.. serious issue with favoritism.. not recommended.

Terrible teacher. It doesn't matter how hard you work, because he has favourites. If he likes you, you get a good grade, if he doesn't, you're in trouble. This man should not be teaching. Those who commented positively were one of his select favourites. If you take this course, choose another section!!

great prof! Hard midterm but grade will go up with project and final just listen in class and participate you will be fine! class is actually VERY interesting and Guolla is quite entertaining! and dont be late!
interesting class good teacher
cocky... class structure is not well organized.  favours certain people.
He favours certain students over others. Does not help students and he is cocky. Can be funny sometimes.
Good prof, be prepared to be involved in class discussions

Guolla is a good teacher, his classes are a bit scattered and he loves to get off topic but he's a funny guy. Get to know him, you'll do better in the class that way. We worked like mad on the final assignment but it paid off...he loves over-achievers

Good course.  Good prof.  He has a funny sense of humour and reminds me of Lumburg from the movie Office Space.  Projects are time consuming but interesting.  Cases are also interesting.  His book is not so good and the classes don't necessarily follow the book.  Hard to study.  OVERALL WORTH TAKING
Great Teacher! Actually takes the time to know everybodys name.  Has a very interactive format to his classes, workload is minimal and sense of humour is hilarious, kinda like bill lumburgh
guolla is a very good professor and is fairly fair. He has a very dry sense of humor though that is reflected in his lectures so unless you want to be cornered do your readings
